Can someone give me pointers to info on how I can setup automated
building & testing for Java apps? I'm looking at doing frequent
builds (e.g. nightly builds) and am not sure how to get all the
pieces to work together.

Here's what I (think I) know so far...

The development platform is Windows NT 4.0 SP 6.

I have an Java application, Ant, and JUnit. I can, via Ant, build
and run the JUnit tests that I have created.

I just grabbed a copy of CVS and placed all the files under CVS.

I downloaded TomCat and installed Tomcat and can start it up.

I downloaded CruiseControl, JCVS, and jcvslet.


Here's where I'm stuck and could use pointers to some info/docs
on this stuff.

A) How to setup CVS to allow other developers to access/change the
   code (server mode)? I D/Led JCVS client code, but I'm not sure
   what I need to do, to get a CVS server going. Do I run the
   jcvslet? If so how? I'd like to understand how to setup to use
   CVS in a multi-developer environment (I used to other tools).

B) It sounds like to automate the build I need to run CruiseControl.
   Part of the setup for CruiseControl says to install a servlet
   engine (TomCat). I have done that, but I don't know how to configure
   TomCat (type 1,2 or 3 mode). Also I don't know how to install the
   WAR file like they are saying. I guess I don't have a grasp yet on
   all this servlet stuff (any book suggestions?).

C) I'd like to get to the point where it checks to see if files have
   been altered (checked in) and will automatically check out the
   latest code and build it, run the tests, and e-mail me the results.
   It sounds like CruiseCOntrol will do all this. Is that correct? Do
   I have to run CVS in server (versus local) mode to do all this?


Wow! There sure is alot to all this. If you have any insights, know of
web pages or docs, or newsgroups where this has been hashed out
already, I sure would appreciate any info you can provide.

Thanks in advance!
